snippet: New York State’s Court of Appeals upheld a lower-court ruling, most likely ending a long battle over the plan, which would add four buildings in Greenwich Village.
abstract: New York State Court of Appeals upholds ruling allowing New York University to proceed with expansion plan involving several pieces of municipal land in Greenwich Village neighborhood that have long been used as public parks.
lead_paragraph: New York State’s Court of Appeals upheld a lower-court ruling, most likely ending a long battle over the plan, which would add four buildings in Greenwich Village.

headline.main: Court Allows N.Y.U.’s Contested Expansion Plan to Go Forward
headline.print_headline: Upholding a Lower Ruling, a Court Allows N.Y.U.’s Contested Expansion Plan to Proceed
